titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stella Hope Shurtleff manuscript, 1935-1936 MS 237
titlestmt.author: Lauren Meyers

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 19:27:26 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: This collection contains the manuscript of a book by Stella Shurtleff called "Art Came to Texas: A Story of the History of Art in Texas". Also included are notes and correspondence regarding the history of art in Texas.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: No information is currently available on the author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the manuscript of a book by Stella Shurtleff called "Art Came to Texas: A Story of the History of Art in Texas". Also included are notes and correspondence regarding the history of art in Texas.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Shurtleff Papers must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to Fondren Library by Mrs. M. Scott and Mrs. M. Jourdan Atkinson on September 18, 1966.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stella Shurtleff Papers, 1935-36, MS 237 Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

did.unittitle: Manuscript (527 pages), 4x6 note cards, and 3x5 post cards in good condition.
